ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Recommended if you have any interest in botany.

Great overview of plant systematics gives a baseline in terminology and familiarity of parts to competently identify plants in the future.I would recommend if the above was what they wanted out of a course. If not they will be disappointed/bored.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am so pleased that this course was finally offered at Yale and hope that it will continue to be offered in the future. This course gave me a better understanding of the phylogenetic relationships between different plant families I am working with in my dissertation and will help me to identify plants during field work in the future.

I am working on fossil plants, and this class not only looked at the evolution of plants but also taught me the terminology and methods with which to look at the fossils. Having little background on plants this was a very helpful course.
Will help me i.d. plants more accurately and quickly during dissertation research.
